#include "text\eng\string_table_ui.xml" #include "text\eng\string_table_items.xml" #include "text\eng\string_table_tutorial.xml" #include "text\eng\string_table_enc_social.xml" #include "text\eng\string_table_level_tips.xml" #include "text\eng\string_table_enc_vehicles.xml" #include "text\eng\string_table_amk_arts_desc.xml" #include "text\eng\string_table_amkzp_arts_desc.xml" #include "text\eng\string_table_enc_ald_weapons.xml"
Holy shit! Did you add some zeroes to that price by mistake?! ... It had better be worth it... here, take your money ...
Consider it you're lucky day ... hand it over, then ...
Please, don't kill me! I have a wife, and children at home waiting for me ... please!!, wait .. just wait .. I have something for you. You see, back there at the base, I was just a simple pencil pusher - a desk jockey - sitting behind an old computer messing around with reports and documents, and stuff. I came across this file one day ... well, I had to mess around with the code for a while before I managed to crack it ... couldn't bring myself to make a copy, but I've memorized it well - it was a report from those Scientific Eggheads about artefacts and anomalies!! It was saying that if you take some mesa... er .. um ... meso-something or other... called 'Ancient Grandma's Beads', or some ridiculous name like that, don't ask what it means, I don't have the slightest clue - and throw it into something they called a 'Whirligig', then in ten minutes time, you'll get a different artefact altogether. Well, it's essentially the same one, but with different properties. It emits some kind of energy-field that somehow manages to slow down time. Also, it can supposedly stop bleeding, and can repair one's health. Unfortunately, it contains radiation, which can cause significant damage over time. I hope this information is of more use to you than it is to me... and that it's worth sparing my life for ... please!! .... I'm begging you ...
Book from the Sarcophagus No1.
Book from the Sarcophagus No1. Notes of the Monolithian - Volume I
Book from the Sarcophagus No2.
Book from the Sarcophagus No2. Notes of the Monolithian - volume II
Book from the Sarcophagus No3.
Book from the Sarcophagus No3. Notes of the Monolithian - volume III
Detailed plan of the Radar Bunker
Detailed plan of the Radar Bunker. On it is marked an old passage into the Sarcophagus ...
Gold Chunk
Gold Chunk
Special version of "the Meat Chunk" artefact. It is only possible to find this rare treasure in the vicinity of the Chernobyl NPP. It possesses a number of positive properties in addition to those already found within the 'Meat Chunk' artefact. It also provides protection from chemical burns, and offers protection against psi-emissions ...
Andrey's PDA [Spetsnaz]
Andrey's PDA [Spetsnaz] - badly damaged, and in serious need of repair ...
Gray's PDA [Mercenary]
Gray's PDA (contains his personal notes)
Ary's USB-Stick [Mercenary]
Ary's PDA (contains his personal notes)
Fraera's PDA
Fraera's PDA (contains his personal notes)
Wounded Bandit's PDA
PDA belonging to the wounded Bandit from the Dump
Soldier's Note
Soldier's Note ... covered in blood, in some places, the ink has begun to run ...
Owl's Note
Note from Owl addressed to Ghost
Owl's USB-Stick
Owl's USB-Stick (contains info about a cache in Lab X-10
Metal Box (locked)
Metal Box with a coded lock
Animal's USB-Stick
Animals USB-Stick. Contains a list of people chosen for assassination. The first name on the list: Strelok
Animal's Documents
Contains a list of the people with whom Animal communicated. However, it has been is ciphered. It is necessary to bring them to Ghost. With a little luck, he can decode the cipher ...
Computer from Lab X-18
Computer from Lab X-18 ... a bit damaged, but surprisingly it still boots up fine ... it may possibly even work.
Scientist's USB-Stick
Scientist's USB-Stick .. contains schedules, figures, and complex diagrams. None of which I understand the least of ...
Arhara's Notebook
Arhara's Notebook. In relatively good condition. In plain text, it marks an entrance ...
Ghost's PDA
Contains various data concerning Artefacts, and the places that they occur. The annihilation of the Last Day Clan and the subsequent murder of it's leader is also mentioned. there is also some information concerning Fang, and Strelok, but the data has been cleverly ciphered ...
Ghost's Diary
Ghost's Diary. Written in a very heavy hand. The ink has started to smear from having gotten wet in the Zone.
Arhara's Notebook
Arhara's Notebook. Full of complex math, and indecipherable formulas ... none of which I can understand.
Tirana's PDA
Tirana's PDA. Contains various sums, accounts, and records. There is also mention of some names ... nicknames.
Lucky's PDA
Contains Lucky's correspondence with some of his accomplices ...
Freeman's Case
Documents belonging to Gordon Freeman. Contains some photos, and other personal effects.
Documents from Laboratory X-10
Documents from Laboratory X-10. Various data concerning the Monolith faction, and more importantly a map showing how to get to the Monolith itself. Other important information concerning the radiation level inside of the Sarcophagus, it's possible obstacles, and when the Monolith patrols change shift, etc ... some very useful information.
Bland's USB-Stick
Contains a carefully prepared plan to take over Chernobyl and the Monolith

Sakharov knows about the death of Fang and advises me to talk to Voronin

Investigation
According to Voronin, Fang was somehow crossed by Mercenaries. Advises me to go to the Informant. He should have connections with the Mercenaries. I can most likely learn more from him ...
